articles.author: Sharon Chen
articles.title: Xi Has Lots at Stake as China Officials Point Fingers Over Virus
articles.description: Since taking power Chinese President Xi Jinping has effectively made himself “chairman of everything.” The coronavirus scare is showing all the risks involved with that strategy.
articles.content:
Xi Jinping
Photographer: Nyein Chan Naing/AFP via Getty Images
Since taking power Chinese President Xi Jinping has effectively made himself “chairman of everything.” The coronavirus scare is showing all the risks involved with that strategy.

articles.title: Coronavirus Eclipses Trade as Global Economy's Biggest Threat
articles.description: The health emergency will crimp growth in China and could prevent it from honoring commitments in the phase-one deal with the U.S.
articles.content:
A check-in counter for China Eastern Airlines is deserted at Incheon International Airport, west of Seoul, on Jan. 28.
Delegations of dark-suited trade negotiators shuttling back-and-forth between Washington and Beijing seemed to hold the world economy’s fat… [+6069 chars]
